content: eight crafters welcome to the craft today I'm going to show you some really
super easy huts to make now this is kind of a tie-in to my farland Isle project
if you haven't seen that make sure you check it out and today we're going to do
part one which is assembling the huts and then part two we will paint them so
let's go the table and I'll show you how I make these super easy huts
now here's what I'm gonna use for my base material it's these seeding pots
okay and there's ten in here and I got this for a dollar so this is great so I
can make ten Hut's out of this pack and I really like the texture on these pots
too so those will be great for the project now I need to make the door so
my doors are usually an inch wide and a half an inch or an inch and a half tall
so I'm going to put some marks on the piece and then kind of draw a door on
there and I'll just cut it out with my small scissors and that'll be the portal
to the to the hut all right now I want to add some detail the door I'm going to
use some toothpicks that are flat on the edges there's different kinds you can
get so I just want to I just want to take a little bit off the end I'm gonna
cut a half an inch off and that's where I'm gonna put the these toothpicks on
the edge of the door to give a detail so I just use white glue now I'm going to
cut some half an inch pieces off the other glue star off the other toothpicks
and I'm used up for detail too so I'm going to put it time put them at the top
of the door and that will just give a neat little detail and you'll see how
good that looks when we paint it up all right now just remove some the extra
glue there and there we go all set now I want to make a roof okay so I've got
they thin of a piece of thin cardstock and I'm going to use this just as tape
roll and cut out the circle okay now here's a neat trick you can find the
center of the circle I've just got that was just a DVD cover so I'm going to
bend it and then put some glue on it and that will give it my kind of conical
shape now I'm going to cut some Nick's out of the edge and that'll make it look
like a grass roof okay I'll start using my glue gun and cover up the the fold
there and I'll just start working detail on the
there I'm using my small glue gun because I want to look like grass on the
roof okay now I finished up I filled it all in and be careful not to cover up
those Nick's because you want those to show through so I'll just fill that in
and it's good to go look at that great texture on there and it strengthens the
roof also now this is all dry it looks really good but I want to kind of
strengthen up this pot okay it's just basically paper so I'm gonna paint this
white glue on there I mean I'm just wetting it down with my wet brush I'm
just putting white glue on with a wet brush and that helps spread it out so
it's not so viscous it's gonna cover the whole thing and I'll just let it dry now
I want to do the base okay I went this is gonna be a 2.5 D Hut let me use one
of my one of my other huts or reminding our pots I should say and measure around
the bit the the base of it and I'm gonna cut them out and these are what I'm
going to use for the basis of my 2.5 D now this is a really thin cardboard okay
so what I'm going to do is I'm going to measure a inch along the edge now just
fill that in you can see that's where the doorway will be okay and this will
be important you'll see in a sec okay so I'm going to measure where those two
inch marks were and I'm gonna cut across because I want the door that to be where
the door is okay so you've got the door and then the
outer hut all right so now how I'm going to do the 2.5 D is I'm going to it a
little different than I usually do I don't want it very high so I'm going to
use the glue gun and rim this piece of thin cardboard to get my 2.5 D okay so
let's go around and this will be nice way to simulate that 2.5 D without
making it really tall like we normally would because this Hut's you know pretty
small now I'm going to take my roof here and I have a punch tool and I'm going to
poke through the bottom of the roof right in the center there and push it
just push it right through okay watch your fingers and there we go now
it does tend to push it up a little bit okay so I'm gonna do is I'm gonna take
the tool and push it back through and I'll kind of push the cardboard back
into the hole there okay just push a little bit and there we go it's ready
for the next step all right so here's my guys I'll dry now I'm gonna put the roof
on just put some hot glue stick that on there and wow look how good that looks
already just saw these cheap pots you now want to reinforce it some more so
I'm going to do the same thing put some white glue on the outside and then just
paint just painting the inside with a wet brush and that'll this is just gonna
help reinforce this you don't really have to do this but I like to just give
them more strength there we go we'll let that dry up and I want to make the door
so I'm gonna use some more of this thin cardboard okay but I want it to be kind
of like a curtain type doorway I don't want it to be actually like a opening
kind of doorway so I'm gonna cut a piece that you know looks like it'll fit on it
doesn't have to be exact and then yep sure enough so now what I need to do is
just glue it in with the glue gun and I'll just put it into place and I'll
glue those edges inside so it doesn't come loose right and now I'm gonna do if
the glue guys I'm gonna go around and start doing kind of like a curtain like
texture it's gonna be like a skin or a curtain covering the entrance of the hut
and I want to do that texture on there with the glue gun so just use my small
glue gun and there we go looking good all right why one last details I'm going
to take some regular toothpicks round toothpicks and cut them in half okay and
I'm gonna use these on the top a little bit of glue and position them so they're
kind of pointing outward from each other and that will give a nice little extra
detail of the hut and now we're ready for the painting phase I'll see you next
time eight crafters I hope you found this bit and informative make sure to
check out part two also and if you like this type of crafting make sure to check
out my forum and Facebook page we have a lot of great crafters on here I give
advice and tips and also make sure that these videos with your friends I have
tons of videos to share so make sure you do that also give a little Scottie alack
if you did like the video and last but not least go forth and crafts oh nice
little Hut finally a rudder can have a little respite but right it's that noise
